Description: Body sherd of North Ionian pottery black-figured dinos (or oinochoe?); interior reserved; exterior, yellow-cream slip: part of a lion to right; filling ornaments: pendant roundel and rosette; red patch on body and on neck of lion.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Published (as an oinochoe) in CVA Oxford 2, II D, p. 80, no. 41, pl. IV.41, which gives 1925.608d as the inventory number. Certainly the piece was not originally registered as 1925.608e, as it differs from the kind of wares described in the Ashmolean Museum register as belonging to this registration sequence, even if 1928.608e is the number it now bears.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D pl. 4, 41)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.439)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1925.606d (possible alternative accession number (see comment))
